docs.summary: Create and manage eCommerce orders

permissions.name: Manage eCommerce - all permissions
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's Wix eCommerce data, including cart, checkout, and order data. This permission scope contains all of the eCommerce permissions.

permissions.name: Manage Orders
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's Wix Stores orders.

docs.summary:
Add's a custom activity or a merchant comment to an order.

Examples of custom activities:
+ Platform - notifications, payments
+ Stores - digital link sent, pickup read, tracking link updated
+ Bookings - checked-in, no-show, rescheduled, cancellation mail sent, reminders sent
+ Events - attendee check-in, reminder mail sent, Zoom link set

permissions.name: Read eCommerce - all read permissions
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's Wix eCommerce (ecom) data, including cart, checkout, and order data. This permission scope contains all of the read eCommerce permissions.

permissions.name: Read Orders
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's Wix Stores order info.

permissions.name: Read Stores - all read permissions
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's Wix Stores data, including products and orders. This permission scope contains all of the read Stores permissions.

permissions.name: Manage eCommerce - all permissions
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's Wix eCommerce data, including cart, checkout, and order data. This permission scope contains all of the eCommerce permissions.

permissions.name: Manage Orders
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's Wix Stores orders.

params.name: aggregation
params.doc: This is an object defining aggregation itself

params.name: hierarchySeparatorOverride
params.doc:
Optional custom separator string that can be used to override default separator value '|'
 for hierarchical responses of multifaceted aggregation requests like:
 '{"aggregation": {"example_request_key": {"$count" : ["deliveryMethod", "shippingRegion"]}}}'
 with example response for default '|' separator like:
 '{"aggregates" :{"example_request_key": {"(Mail|Region 1)": 5, "(Pickup|Region 2)": 10}}}'

permissions.name: Manage eCommerce - all permissions
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's Wix eCommerce data, including cart, checkout, and order data. This permission scope contains all of the eCommerce permissions.

permissions.name: Manage Orders
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's Wix Stores orders.

params.name: sendOrderCanceledEmail
params.doc: Whether to send an order canceled email to the buyer.

params.name: customMessage
params.doc: Custom note to be added to the email (optional).

params.name: restockAllItems
params.doc: Whether to restock all items in the order. This will only apply to products in the Wix Stores inventory.

docs.summary: Cancels an order. The `order.status` field changes to `CANCELED`.

examples.title: Cancel Order
body:
curl -X POST \
 'https://www.wixapis.com/ecom/v1/orders/7001d34b-11a6-4a34-8746-dc8ababeca42/cancel' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Authorization: <AUTH>' \
  --data-binary '{
    "sendOrderCanceledEmail": true,
    "customMessage": "Canceled due to incorrect quantity ordered",
    "restockAllItems": true
  }'

extra.description: Cancels an order, sends order cancellation email with custom message, and restocks all items

params.name: draftOrderId
params.doc:
Draft order Id representing this change.
 Use this ID to get this specific draft content. call .../v1/draft-orders/{draft_order_id}/get

params.name: changes
params.doc: Draft order changes to be applied

params.name: commitSettings
params.doc: Side-effects to happen after order is updated

params.name: reason
params.doc: Reason for edit, given by user (optional).

docs.summary:
Creates an order.


> **Notes:**
> + If an item is digital - `lineItems[i].itemType.preset: DIGITAL` - then `lineItems[i].digitalFile` must be provided.
> + If `lineItems[i].id` is passed, it must be either a valid GUID, or empty.

docs.summary:
<!--ONLY:REST-->
Internal query orders endpoint without additional logic to hide INIT orders.
Returns a list of up to 100 orders, given the provided paging, filtering and sorting.

To learn how to query orders, see
[API Query Language](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/api-query-language).
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

permissions.name: Read eCommerce - all read permissions
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's Wix eCommerce (ecom) data, including cart, checkout, and order data. This permission scope contains all of the read eCommerce permissions.

permissions.name: Read Orders
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's Wix Stores order info.

permissions.name: Read Stores - all read permissions
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's Wix Stores data, including products and orders. This permission scope contains all of the read Stores permissions.

permissions.name: Manage eCommerce - all permissions
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's Wix eCommerce data, including cart, checkout, and order data. This permission scope contains all of the eCommerce permissions.

permissions.name: Manage Orders
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's Wix Stores orders.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of orders, given the provided paging, filtering, and sorting.


Search Orders runs with these defaults, which you can override:

- `createdDate` is sorted in `DESC` order
- `cursorPaging.limit` is `100`
- `filter: {"status": {"$ne": "INITIALIZED"}}` - other order statuses can be queried, but orders with `status: "INITIALIZED"` are never returned

For field support for filters and sorting, see [Orders: Supported Filters and Sorting](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/wix-e-commerce/orders/supported-filters-and-sorting).

To learn about working with _Search_ endpoints, see
[API Query Language](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/api-query-language), and
[Sorting and Paging](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/sorting-and-paging).

examples.title: Search Orders by Payment and Fulfillment Statuses, Sorted by Name

docs.summary: Updates an order's activity.

permissions.name: Manage eCommerce - all permissions
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's Wix eCommerce data, including cart, checkout, and order data. This permission scope contains all of the eCommerce permissions.

permissions.name: Manage Orders
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's Wix Stores orders.

docs.summary:
Updates an order's properties.

Currently, the following fields can be updated:
+ `order.buyerInfo.email`
+ `order.recipientInfo.address`
+ `order.recipientInfo.contactDetails`
+ `order.shippingInfo.logistics.shippingDestination.address`
+ `order.shippingInfo.logistics.shippingDestination.contactDetails`

To update a field's value, include the new value in the `order` object in the body params.
To remove a field's value, pass `null`.

> **Note:** Removing `buyerInfo` or `contactDetails` results in an error.

examples.title: Update Order
Update Order

extra.description: Updates order shipping address and contact details.

members.name: original
members.doc:
__Required.__ Item name in the site's default language.

Min: 1 character.  
Max: 200 characters.

members.name: translated
members.doc:
Item name translated into the buyer's language.

Min: 1 character.  
Max: 400 characters.
Default: Same as `original`.

members.name: original
members.doc: Description line name in the site's default language.

members.name: translated
members.doc:
Description line name translated into the buyer's language.

 Default: Same as `original`.

members.name: original
members.doc: Description line plain text value in the site's default language.

members.name: translated
members.doc:
Description line plain text value translated into the buyer's language.

 Default: Same as `original`.

members.name: original
members.doc: Description line color name in the site's default language.

members.name: translated
members.doc:
Description line color name translated into the buyer's language.

 Default: Same as `original`.

members.name: code
members.doc: HEX or RGB color code for display.

members.name: subtotal
members.doc: Subtotal of all the line items, before discounts and before tax.

members.name: shipping
members.doc: Total shipping price, before discounts and before tax.

members.name: total
members.doc: Orders total price after discounts and tax.

members.name: totalAdditionalFees
members.doc: Total price of additional fees before tax.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Subdivision. Usually a state, region, prefecture, or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc: Free text providing more detailed address info. Usually contains Apt, Suite, and Floor.

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line, usually street and number as free text.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Tax type.

Supported values:
+ `CPF`: for individual tax payers
+ `CNPJ`: for corporations

docs.summary: Physical address

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Code for a subdivision (such as state, prefecture, or province) in [ISO 3166-2](https://www.iso.org/standard/72483.html) format.

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line (usually street name and number).

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc: Free text providing more detailed address info. Usually contains apt, suite, floor.

docs.summary: Full contact details for an address

members.name: vatId
members.doc: Tax information (for Brazil only). If ID is provided, `vatId.type` must also be set, `UNSPECIFIED` is not allowed.

docs.summary: Billing Info and shipping details
Physical address

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Code for a subdivision (such as state, prefecture, or province) in [ISO 3166-2](https://www.iso.org/standard/72483.html) format.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street address object, with number, name, and apartment number in separate fields.

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line (usually street name and number).

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc: Free text providing more detailed address info. Usually contains apt, suite, floor.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. Unordered map of dynamically typed values.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: fields
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Unordered map of dynamically typed values.

members.name: taxableAmount
members.doc: Taxable amount of this line item.

members.name: taxRate
members.doc: Tax rate percentage, as a decimal numeral between 0 and 1. For example, `"0.13"`.

members.name: totalTax
members.doc: The calculated tax, based on the `taxableAmount` and `taxRate`.

docs.summary:
the amount on which tax is calculated, added from line items
com.wix.ecommerce.platform_common.api.Price taxable_amount = 1 [(.wix.api.readOnly) = true];

members.name: totalPriceBeforeTax
members.doc: Total price of shipping after discounts (when relevant), and before tax.

members.name: totalPriceAfterTax
members.doc: Shipping price after all discounts (if any exist), and after tax.

members.name: carrierId
members.doc: App Def Id of external provider which was a source of shipping info

members.name: code
members.doc: Unique code (or ID) of selected shipping option. For example, `"usps_std_overnight"``.

members.name: title
members.doc:
Shipping option title.
 For example, `"USPS Standard Overnight Delivery"`, `"Standard"` or `"First-Class Package International"`.

docs.summary:
unique identifier of the shipping region
    google.protobuf.StringValue id = 1 [(.wix.api.format) = GUID, (.wix.api.readOnly) = true];

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of shipping region. For example, `"Metropolitan London"`, or `"Outer Melbourne suburbs"`.

members.name: deliveryTime
members.doc: Expected delivery time in free text. For example, `"3-5 business days"`.

members.name: instructions
members.doc: Instructions for carrier. For example, `"Please knock on the door. If unanswered, please call contact number. Thanks."`.

members.name: deliverByDate
members.doc: Deprecated - Latest expected delivery date and time in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations) format.

docs.summary: Used for grouping line items. Sent when an item is added to a cart, checkout, or order.

members.name: catalogItemId
members.doc: ID of the item within the catalog it belongs to.

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app providing the catalog.

You can get your app's ID from its page in the [Wix Dev Center](https://dev.wix.com/apps).

For items from Wix catalogs, the following values always apply:
+ Wix Stores: `"215238eb-22a5-4c36-9e7b-e7c08025e04e"`
+ Wix Bookings: `"13d21c63-b5ec-5912-8397-c3a5ddb27a97"`
+ Wix Restaurants: `"9a5d83fd-8570-482e-81ab-cfa88942ee60"`

members.name: options
members.doc:
Additional item details in key:value pairs.

 Use this optional field to specify a variant of the item or add custom details. There are several ways to use `options`:
 + Pass specific information about the item variant in this field. For example, size and color of an item of clothing: `"options": {"Size": "M", "Color": "Red"}`.
 + Create a separate API for creating item variants that stores the details and generates a unique ID for each item variant. Then pass only the variant ID in this field. For example: `"options": {"variantId": "<VARIANT_ID>"}`.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Custom item type. When none of the preset types are suitable, specifies the custom type.

members.name: weight
members.doc: Line item weight. Measurement unit matches the weight unit specified in `weightUnit` in the request.

members.name: shippable
members.doc: Whether this line item is shippable.

members.name: fileId
members.doc: ID of the secure file in media.

members.name: link
members.doc: Link will exist after the digital links have been generated on the order.

members.name: cycleNumber
members.doc: Subscription cycle. For example, if this order is for the 3rd cycle of a subscription, value will be `3`.

members.name: subscriptionOptionTitle
members.doc: Subscription option title. For example, `"Monthly coffee Subscription"`.

members.name: subscriptionOptionDescription
members.doc: Subscription option description. For example, `"1kg of selected coffee, once a month"`.

members.name: autoRenewal
members.doc: Whether subscription is renewed automatically at the end of each period.

members.name: billingCycles
members.doc: Number of billing cycles before subscription ends. Ignored if `autoRenewal: true`.

members.name: original
members.doc: __Required.__ Price description in the site's default language.

members.name: translated
members.doc:
Price description translated into the buyer's language.

 Default: Same as `original`.

members.name: id
members.doc: Location id in the associated owner app.

members.name: appId
members.doc: Location owner app, if not provided then the site business info locations will be used.

members.name: catalogReference
members.doc:
References to the line item's origin catalog.
 This field is empty in the case of a custom line item.

members.name: totalDiscount
members.doc: Total discount for this line item's entire quantity.

members.name: descriptionLines
members.doc: Line item description lines. Used for display purposes for the cart, checkout and order.

members.name: physicalProperties
members.doc: Physical properties of the item. When relevant, contains information such as SKU and item weight.

members.name: itemType
members.doc: Item type. Either a preset type or custom.

members.name: fulfillerId
members.doc:
Fulfiller ID. Field is empty when the line item is self-fulfilled.
 To get fulfillment information, pass the order ID to [List Fulfillments For Single Order](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/wix-e-commerce/order-fulfillments/list-fulfillments-for-single-order).

members.name: restockQuantity
members.doc: quantity of inventory requested to be returned. Whether to restock or ignore the request is up the vertical.

members.name: price
members.doc: Line item price after line item discounts for display purposes.

members.name: priceBeforeDiscounts
members.doc: Line item price before line item discounts for display purposes. Defaults to `price` when not provided.

members.name: totalPriceBeforeTax
members.doc: Total price after discounts, and before tax.

members.name: totalPriceAfterTax
members.doc: Total price after all discounts and tax.

members.name: paymentOption
members.doc:
Type of selected payment option for current item. Defaults to `FULL_PAYMENT_ONLINE`.
 + `FULL_PAYMENT_ONLINE` - The entire payment for this item happens as part of the checkout.
 + `FULL_PAYMENT_OFFLINE` - The entire payment for this item happens after the checkout. For example, when using cash, check, or other offline payment methods.
 + `MEMBERSHIP` - Payment for this item is done by charging a membership. When this option is used, `lineItem.price.amount` is 0.
 + `DEPOSIT_ONLINE` - Partial payment for the given item to be paid upfront during the checkout. Eligible for catalog items with type `DEPOSIT_ONLINE` only.

members.name: taxDetails
members.doc: Tax details for this line item.

members.name: priceDescription
members.doc: Additional description for the price. For example, when price is 0 but additional details about the actual price are needed - "Starts at $67".

members.name: depositAmount
members.doc: Item's price amount to be charged during checkout. Relevant for items with a `paymentOption` value of `"DEPOSIT_ONLINE"`.

docs.summary: Coupon

members.name: original
members.doc: Original discount rule name (in site's default language).

members.name: translated
members.doc: Translated discount rule name according to buyer language. Defaults to `original` when not provided.

members.name: discountType
members.doc:
Discount type.
 * `"GLOBAL"` - discount applies to entire order.
 * `"SPECIFIC-ITEMS"` - discount applies to specific items.
 * `"SHIPPING"` - discount applies to shipping. For example, free shipping.

members.name: lineItemIds
members.doc: IDs of line items discount applies to.

members.name: discountReason
members.doc:
Pre-defined discount reason (optional).
 * `"ITEMS_EXCHANGE"` - exchange balance acquired as a result of items exchange.

members.name: code
members.doc: Additional fee's unique code for future processing.

members.name: lineItemIds
members.doc:
Optional - Line items associated with this additional fee.
 If no `lineItemIds` are provided, the fee will be associated with the whole cart/checkout/order.

members.name: priceDescriptionBeforeChange
members.doc: The price description before the change

members.name: Delta
members.doc:
Type and details of the change versus the baseline order
 None means didn't change.

messages.name: _com_wix_ecom_orders_v1_OrderLineItemChangedDetails
messages.displayName: Order Line Item Changed Details Object

members.name: catalogReference
members.doc:
References to the line item's origin catalog.
 This field is empty in the case of a custom line item.

members.name: totalDiscount
members.doc: Total discount for this line item's entire quantity.

members.name: descriptionLines
members.doc: Line item description lines. Used for display purposes for the cart, checkout and order.

members.name: physicalProperties
members.doc: Physical properties of the item. When relevant, contains information such as SKU and item weight.

members.name: itemType
members.doc: Item type. Either a preset type or custom.

members.name: fulfillerId
members.doc:
Fulfiller ID. Field is empty when the line item is self-fulfilled.
 To get fulfillment information, pass this order's ID to [List Fulfillments For Single Order](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/ecommerce/order-fulfillments/list-fulfillments-for-single-order).

members.name: price
members.doc: Line item price after line item discounts for display purposes.

members.name: priceBeforeDiscounts
members.doc: Line item price before line item discounts for display purposes. Defaults to `price` when not provided.

members.name: totalPriceAfterTax
members.doc: Total price after all discounts and tax.

members.name: paymentOption
members.doc:
Type of selected payment option for current item. Defaults to `FULL_PAYMENT_ONLINE`.
 + `FULL_PAYMENT_OFFLINE` - The entire payment for this item happens after the checkout. For example, when using cash, check, or other offline payment methods.
 + `MEMBERSHIP` - Payment for this item is done by charging a membership. When this option is used, `lineItem.price.amount` is 0.

members.name: taxDetails
members.doc: Tax details for this line item.

members.name: priceDescription
members.doc: Additional description for the price. For example, when price is 0 but additional details about the actual price are needed - "Starts at $67".

members.name: totalPriceBeforeTax
members.doc: Total price after all discounts excluding tax.

members.name: sendNotificationsToBuyer
members.doc: If false, do not send notifications to buyer. Default is true.

members.name: sendNotificationsToBusiness
members.doc: If false, do not send notifications to business. Default is true.

members.name: addActivitiesToOrder
members.doc: If false,do not add activities to the order. Default is true.

members.name: sendNotificationsToCustomFulfillers
members.doc: If false, do not send mails to custom fulfillers in case of a change of shippable items fulfilled by custom fulfillers. Default is true.

members.name: inventoryUpdates
members.doc: Inventory changes to be applied. Either to restock, or decrease.

members.name: actionType
members.doc: Action to be applied - decrease or restock

members.name: quantityChange
members.doc: The amount to be increased or restocked

members.name: appliedDiscounts
members.doc:
Added/updated/removed discounts.
todo: set (.wix.api.maxSize). need to find it. existing : merchant can have 100 + 1 coupon + ? due to automatic discounts

members.name: taxSummary
members.doc: Updated Tax summary. overwrites existing tax summary.

members.name: priceSummary
members.doc:
Updated order price summary. overwrites existing price summary.
 balance will be updated automatically.

members.name: changedShippingInfo
members.doc: Shipping info and selected shipping option details.

members.name: reason
members.doc: Reason for edit, given by user (optional).

members.name: diff
members.doc: Difference between original and new quantity. Absolute value.

members.name: deltaType
members.doc: Type of quantity change: increase or decrease.

members.name: name
members.doc: Discount name: coupon name / discount rule name / merchant discount description.

members.name: affectedLineItems
members.doc: Line items additional fee applies to.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Amount associated with this item. (Discount amount for item / additional fee amount for item)

members.name: originalTotal
members.doc: Orders total price after discounts and tax. Before update

members.name: newTotal
members.doc: Orders total price after discounts and tax. After update

members.name: orderRefunded
members.doc: Additional info about order refunded activity (optional). `activity.type` must be `ORDER_REFUNDED`.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Internal activity creation date and time.

members.name: orderPaid
members.doc: Order paid. Either by the store owner (for offline orders), or when an online transaction was confirmed.

members.name: orderFulfilled
members.doc: Order shipping status set as fulfilled.

members.name: orderNotFulfilled
members.doc: Order shipping status set as not fulfilled.

members.name: downloadLinkSent
members.doc: Download link was sent (relevant for orders with digital line items).

members.name: trackingNumberAdded
members.doc: Shipping tracking number added to order.

members.name: trackingLinkAdded
members.doc: Shipping tracking link added to order.

members.name: shippingConfirmationEmailSent
members.doc: An email confirmation of order shipment was sent.

members.name: invoiceSent
members.doc: Invoice sent to customer via email.

members.name: orderCreatedFromExchange
members.doc: Order created as a result of items exchange.

members.name: orderPartiallyPaid
members.doc: Order partially paid. During the checkout for orders with deposit items.

docs.summary: Store owner added a comment

members.name: manual
members.doc: Whether order was refunded manually. For example, via payment provider or using cash.

members.name: originalOrderId
members.doc: ID of the original order for which the exchange happened.

members.name: exchangeOrderId
members.doc: ID of the new order created as a result of an exchange of items.

members.name: lineItems
members.doc: IDs of the items that were exchanged.

members.name: lineItemId
members.doc: ID of the exchanged line item.

docs.summary: Order canceled
Order placed
Order marked as paid, either by the store owner (for offline orders), or when an online transaction was confirmed
Order marked as partially paid when an online transaction was confirmed with partial minimal required amount of total sum
Order shipping status set as fulfilled
Order shipping status set as not fulfilled
An email notification for pickup was sent
A download link was sent (relevant for orders with digital line items)
Shipping tracking number was set
Shipping tracking number was edited
Shipping tracking link was set
An email confirmation of order shipment was sent
Invoice was set in the order
Invoice sent to customer via email
Email was sent to fulfiller
Shipping address was updated
Order email was updated
Set of key-value pairs. Additional data in key-value form. For example, `{ "Ticket number": "123456" }`.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

members.name: appId
members.doc: ID of the app that created the custom activity.

members.name: type
members.doc: Custom activity type. For example, `"Ticket number set"`.

members.name: additionalData
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Additional data in key-value form. For example, `{ "Ticket number": "123456" }`.

docs.summary:
Order balance. Reflects amount left to be paid on order and is calculated dynamically. Can be negative per balance definition.
`amount` field depends on order payment status:
+ UNSPECIFIED, NOT_PAID: price_summary.total_price
+ PARTIALLY_PAID : price_summary.total_price - pay_now.total_price
+ PENDING, REFUNDED, PARTIALLY_REFUNDED, PAID : 0

members.name: amount
members.doc:
Balance amount, can be negative. Negative value signifies amount to be refunded
 and can happen due to possible overcharge or modified manual order.

members.name: balance
members.doc: collectible amount to pay. Part of orders price_summary excluding all approved payments amount

members.name: totalSuccesses
members.doc: Number of items that were successfully processed.

members.name: totalFailures
members.doc: Number of items that couldn't be processed.

members.name: undetailedFailures
members.doc: Number of failures without details because detailed failure threshold was exceeded.

members.name: id
members.doc: Item ID. Should always be available, unless it's impossible (for example, when failing to create an item).

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: success
members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

members.name: error
members.doc: Details about the error in case of failure.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID. Auto-created if one does not yet exist. For more information, see [Contacts API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/introduction).

members.name: visitorId
members.doc: Visitor ID (if site visitor is not a member).

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID (if site visitor is a site member).

members.name: userId
members.doc:
User ID - when the order was created by a Wix user on behalf of a buyer.
 For example, via POS (point of service).

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Member ID - when the order was created by a **logged in** site visitor.

members.name: visitorId
members.doc: Visitor ID - when the order was created by a site visitor that was **not** logged in.

members.name: appId
members.doc: App ID - when the order was created by an external application.

members.name: type
members.doc: Sales channel that submitted the order.

members.name: externalOrderId
members.doc: Reference to an order ID from an external system.

members.name: externalOrderUrl
members.doc: URL to the order in the external system.

members.name: statuses
members.doc: Unique string values based on Fulfillment entities statuses

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs.  
Extended field data. Each key corresponds to the namespace of the app that created the extended fields.
The value of each key is structured according to the schema defined when the extended fields were configured.

You can only access fields for which you have the appropriate permissions.

Learn more about [extended fields](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/extended-fields).

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type struct

members.name: namespaces
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs.  
Extended field data. Each key corresponds to the namespace of the app that created the extended fields.
The value of each key is structured according to the schema defined when the extended fields were configured.

You can only access fields for which you have the appropriate permissions.

Learn more about [extended fields](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/extended-fields).

members.name: number
members.doc: Order number displayed in the site owner's dashboard (auto-generated).

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the order was created in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations) format.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the order was last updated in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations) format.

members.name: paymentStatus
members.doc:
Order payment status.
+ `NOT_PAID` - This can be an order made online, but not yet paid. In such cases `order.status` will be `INITIALIZED`.
+ This status also applies when an offline order needs to be manually marked as paid. In such cases `order.status` will be `APPROVED`.
+ `PAID` - All payments associated with this order are paid. For online payments: [`payment.regularPaymentDetails.status: APPROVED`](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/wix-e-commerce/order-transactions/order-transactions-object). For gift cards: [`payment.giftCardPaymentDetails.voided: false`](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/wix-e-commerce/order-transactions/order-transactions-object).
+ `PARTIALLY_REFUNDED` - Order was refunded, but refund amount is less than order total price.
+ `FULLY_REFUNDED` - Order fully refunded. Refund amount equals total price.
+ `PENDING` - Payments received but not yet confirmed by the payment provider.
+ `PARTIALLY_PAID` -  At least one payment was received and approved, covering less than total price amount.

members.name: buyerLanguage
members.doc:
Language for communication with the buyer. Defaults to the site language.
 For a site that supports multiple languages, this is the language the buyer selected.

members.name: weightUnit
members.doc: Weight measurement unit - defaults to site's weight unit.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency used for the pricing of this order in [ISO-4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#List_of_ISO_4217_currency_codes) format.

members.name: taxIncludedInPrices
members.doc: Whether tax is included in line item prices.

members.name: siteLanguage
members.doc: Site language in which original values are shown.

members.name: shippingInfo
members.doc: Shipping info and selected shipping option details.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Order status.
+ `INITIALIZED` - Order was created, but not yet approved or declined.
+ `APPROVED` - Order was approved. This happens when either the online payment succeeded or the order is an offline order. Once an order is approved, many side effects are triggered. For example, holding of stock in the inventory and sending of notification emails.
+ `CANCELED` - Order was canceled by the user.

members.name: channelInfo
members.doc: Information about the sales channel that submitted this order.

members.name: seenByAHuman
members.doc: Whether a human has seen the order. Set when an order is clicked on in the dashboard.

members.name: additionalFees
members.doc: Additional fees applied to the order.

members.name: extendedFields
members.doc:
Custom field data for the order object.
 
[Extended fields](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/extended-fields) must be configured in the Wix Dev Center before they can be accessed with API calls.

members.name: purchaseFlowId
members.doc: Persistent ID that correlates between the various eCommerce elements: cart, checkout, and order.

members.name: recipientInfo
members.doc:
Order recipient address and contact details.

This field may differ from the address in `shippingInfo.logistics` when:
+ The chosen shipping option is pickup point or store pickup.
+ No shipping option is selected.

members.name: item
members.doc: Updated item. Optional - returned only if requested with `return_full_entity` set to `true`.

members.name: lineItemId
members.doc: ID of the line item being decremented.

members.name: restock
members.doc: Whether to restock the line item (triggers inventory update).

docs.summary: Triggered when the fulfillment status of an order is updated

members.name: action
members.doc: the action that caused this update

docs.summary: Triggered when the the order status changes to approved

members.name: restockAllItems
members.doc: Should restock all items on that order

members.name: sendOrderCanceledEmail
members.doc: Should send a confirmation mail to the customer

members.name: customMessage
members.doc: Personal note added to the email

docs.summary: Triggered when order is edited by draftOrders

members.name: draftOrderId
members.doc: Draft order Id representing this change.

members.name: commitSettings
members.doc: Side-effects requested to happen as a result of this edit.

members.name: commitDate
members.doc: Date and time when order deltas were committed.

members.name: appliedDiscounts
members.doc:
Added/updated/removed discounts.
todo: set (.wix.api.maxSize). need to find it. existing : merchant can have 100 + 1 coupon + ? due to automatic discounts

members.name: changedShippingInfo
members.doc: Shipping info and selected shipping option details.

docs.summary: Triggered when order items are marked as restocked

members.name: order
members.doc: The order which items were restocked

members.name: lineItemId
members.doc: ID of the line item being restocked.

members.name: paths
members.doc: The set of field mask paths.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of items to return in the results.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

Pass the relevant cursor token from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursor strings that point to the next page, previous page, or both.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Whether there are more pages to retrieve following the current page.

+ `true`: Another page of results can be retrieved.
+ `false`: This is the last page.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor string pointing to the next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to the previous page in the list of results.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: filter
members.doc:
Filter object.

For example, the following `filter` object will only return orders with payment statuses of paid and/or partially paid:
`"filter": {"paymentStatus": {"$in": ["PAID", "PARTIALLY_PAID"]}}`

Learn more about the filter format [here](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/api-query-language#the-filter-section).

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Array of sort objects that specify the order in which results should be sorted.

For example, the following `sort` array will sort by `createdDate` in descending order:
`"sort": [{"fieldName": "createdDate", "order":"DESC"}]`.

Learn more about the sort format [here](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/api-query-language#the-sort-section).

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results. `cursorPaging.cursor` cannot be used with 'filter' or 'sort'.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: limit
members.doc:
The number of items to load.
 Cursor token returned in the query response. To be used on the next query request, but not the first query request.

members.name: cursor
members.doc: Cursor returned in last query response. Should not be provided on first page request

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pointer to page of results using offset. Cannot be used together with `cursorPaging`.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results. Cannot be used together with `paging`. `cursorPaging.cursor` can not be used together with `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: count
members.doc: The number of items returned in this response.

members.name: offset
members.doc: The offset which was requested. Returned if offset paging was used.

members.name: total
members.doc: The total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging was used.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through result pages. Returned if cursor paging was used.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
 This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
 We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
 Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
 Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
 This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
 Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
 (for example, GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
 For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
  it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
 As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
 To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
  message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

messages.name: _com_wix_ecom_orders_side_effects_migration_api_TriggerSideEffectsFromLegacyData
messages.displayName: Trigger Side Effects From Legacy Data Object

messages.name: _com_wix_ecom_orders_side_effects_migration_api_ContinueSideEffectsFlowInLegacyData
messages.displayName: Continue Side Effects Flow In Legacy Data Object

members.name: source
members.doc: The source of the line item

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

members.name: language
members.doc: ISO 639 alpha-2 or alpha-3 language code, or a language subtag

members.name: country
members.doc: An ISO 3166 alpha-2 country code or a UN M.49 numeric-3 area code.

members.name: subtotal
members.doc: the subtotal of the line items without the tax reduction

members.name: total
members.doc: the total price taking into account the itemized fees and the taxes

members.name: taxable
members.doc: the costs on which the taxes are applied

members.name: taxed
members.doc: the taxes as a result of the

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

members.name: allowEditByOthers
members.doc: Optional indicator whether to allow editing of the invoice by other applications other than the source. Default is true.

members.name: taxes
members.doc: consider calculated or not - cannot enforce set

docs.summary:
A custom field value is used to add additional data to a financial document or to a financial document template.
The custom field value may be based on a custom field definition.

members.name: id
members.doc: The unique id of the custom field value

members.name: displayName
members.doc: The display name of the custom field value

members.name: namespace
members.doc: The optional namespace of the custom field value. This field may be used to indicate intended usage or source.

members.name: group
members.doc: The group of the custom field indicates its intended placement in the financial document

members.name: value
members.doc: The value of the custom field

members.name: originCustomFieldKey
members.doc: The optional key of the custom field definition on which the custom field value is based

members.name: issueDate
members.doc: use UTC midnight date to set the issue date according to the site time zone

members.name: dueDate
members.doc: use UTC midnight date to set the due date according to the site time zone

members.name: lastSeenDate
members.doc: ignored in request use in response to get the site time zone

members.name: orderId
members.doc:
The orderId of the order in cashier associated with the payment.
 This field is populated for external payments that are charged by invoices via AddPayment endpoint.

members.name: transactionId
members.doc:
The transactionId corresponding to the orderId of the payment which are returned by cashier.
 This field is populated for external payments that are charged by invoices via AddPayment endpoint as well.

members.name: number
members.doc: The invoice number allocated the invoice by the server. The number is limited to at most 11 digits.

members.name: currencyCode
members.doc: The invoice 3-letter currency code in [ISO-4217 alphabetic](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html) format.

members.name: customer
members.doc: The invoice customer. The customer must be a contact of the site, with an email.

members.name: dates
members.doc:
Invoice dates: issue date and due date are mandatory and provided when the invoice is created.
 Last seen date is the optional date when the invoice was last seen be UoU.

members.name: lineItems
members.doc:
Line items containing the details of the products or services relevant to the invoice, with their name, prices,
 and quantity. There must be at least one line item on the invoice.

members.name: locale
members.doc:
Locale of the invoice, containing the language.
 This field is not mandatory but is used for display purposes, to determine the appearance of numbers and dates
 on the invoice.

members.name: totals
members.doc:
The totals on the invoice.
 The totals.subtotal, totals.total and totals.taxed_amount are calculated by the server based on the line items.
 Alternatively, these fields can be provided in the invoice creation request, in this case, these values are fixed.
 The totals contain fees and a discount, that apply to the invoice.

members.name: discount
members.doc: An optional discount on the invoice.

members.name: payments
members.doc: The payments on the invoice. The invoice has status paid if its payments cover the invoice total.

members.name: dynamicTotals
members.doc:
The balance and amount paid on the invoice.
 This read-only field is calculated based on the invoice totals and payments.

members.name: deposit
members.doc: The optional deposit of the invoice

members.name: flatAmount
members.doc: The flat amount of the deposit. The flat amount of the deposit must be less than the invoice total.

members.name: percentage
members.doc:
The read-only percentage value of the deposit.
 It is computed according to the flat_amount and the invoice total and is rounded to 2 digits precision.

members.name: type
members.doc: The type of the deposit. The default is FLAT.

members.name: aggregation
members.doc: This is an object defining aggregation itself

members.name: hierarchySeparatorOverride
members.doc:
Optional custom separator string that can be used to override default separator value '|'
 for hierarchical responses of multifaceted aggregation requests like:
 '{"aggregation": {"example_request_key": {"$count" : ["deliveryMethod", "shippingRegion"]}}}'
 with example response for default '|' separator like:
 '{"aggregates" :{"example_request_key": {"(Mail|Region 1)": 5, "(Pickup|Region 2)": 10}}}'

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the order to retrieve.

members.name: ids
members.doc: ID of the order to retrieve.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

members.name: draftOrderId
members.doc:
Draft order Id representing this change.
 Use this ID to get this specific draft content. call .../v1/draft-orders/{draft_order_id}/get

members.name: changes
members.doc: Draft order changes to be applied

members.name: commitSettings
members.doc: Side-effects to happen after order is updated

members.name: reason
members.doc: Reason for edit, given by user (optional).

members.name: activityId
members.doc:
ID of the added internal activity.
 Use this ID to either [update](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/ecommerce/orders/update-activity) or [delete](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/ecommerce/orders/delete-activity) the activity.

members.name: activityId
members.doc:
ID of the added activity.
 Use this ID to either [update](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/ecommerce/orders/update-activity) or [delete](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/ecommerce/orders/delete-activity) the activity.

members.name: activityId
members.doc: ID of the activity to delete.

docs.summary: Triggered when the payment status of an order is updated

Possible values are:
  • UNRECOGNISED
  • PLAIN_TEXT
  • COLOR

tax info types Possible values are:
  • UNSPECIFIED
  • CPF - CPF - for individual tax payers.
  • CNPJ - CNPJ - for corporations

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_SUBDIVISION_TYPE
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_1 - State
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_2 - County
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_3 - City/town
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_4 - Neighborhood/quarter
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_5 - Street/block
  • COUNTRY - ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_0. Indicates the national political entity, and is typically the highest order type returned by the Geocoder.

`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_METHOD
  • STORE_PICKUP
  • PICKUP_POINT

Possible values are:
  • UNRECOGNISED
  • PHYSICAL
  • DIGITAL
  • GIFT_CARD
  • SERVICE

Frequency unit of recurring payment Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • DAY
  • WEEK
  • MONTH
  • YEAR

Type of selected payment option for catalog item Possible values are:
  • FULL_PAYMENT_ONLINE - The entire payment for this item happens as part of the checkout.
  • FULL_PAYMENT_OFFLINE - The entire payment for this item happens after the checkout. For example, when using cash, check, or other offline payment methods.
  • MEMBERSHIP - Payment for this item is done by charging a membership. When selected, `price` is `0`.
  • DEPOSIT_ONLINE - Partial payment to be paid upfront during the checkout. Initial amount to be paid for each line item is specified in `depositAmount`.
  • MEMBERSHIP_OFFLINE - Payment for this item can only be done by charging a membership and must be manually redeemed in the dashboard by the site admin. When selected, `price` is `0`.

Possible values are:
  • GLOBAL
  • SPECIFIC_ITEMS
  • SHIPPING

Possible values are:
  • UNSPECIFIED
  • EXCHANGED_ITEMS

Type of selected payment option for catalog item Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_PAYMENT_OPTION - irrelevant
  • FULL_PAYMENT_OFFLINE - The entire payment for given item will happen after the checkout.
  • MEMBERSHIP_OFFLINE - Payment for this item can only be done using a membership and must be manually redeemed in the dashboard by the site owner. Note: when this option is used, price will be 0.

Possible values are:
  • RESTOCK - Restock inventory
  • DECREASE - Decrease inventory. Without failing on negative inventory.

messages.name: _com_wix_ecom_orders_v1_DraftOrderChangesAppliedTypes_LineItemQuantityChange_LineItemQuantityChangeType
messages.displayName: Line Item Quantity Change Type Object

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • QUANTITY_INCREASED
  • QUANTITY_DECREASED

Possible values are:
  • ORDER_REFUNDED
  • ORDER_PLACED
  • ORDER_PAID
  • ORDER_FULFILLED
  • ORDER_NOT_FULFILLED
  • ORDER_CANCELED
  • DOWNLOAD_LINK_SENT
  • TRACKING_NUMBER_ADDED
  • TRACKING_NUMBER_EDITED
  • TRACKING_LINK_ADDED
  • SHIPPING_CONFIRMATION_EMAIL_SENT
  • INVOICE_ADDED
  • INVOICE_REMOVED
  • INVOICE_SENT
  • FULFILLER_EMAIL_SENT
  • SHIPPING_ADDRESS_EDITED
  • EMAIL_EDITED
  • PICKUP_READY_EMAIL_SENT
  • CUSTOM_ACTIVITY
  • MERCHANT_COMMENT
  • ORDER_CREATED_FROM_EXCHANGE
  • NEW_EXCHANGE_ORDER_CREATED
  • ORDER_PARTIALLY_PAID
  • DRAFT_ORDER_CHANGES_APPLIED

Possible values are:
  • UNSPECIFIED
  • FACEBOOK_ADS

Possible values are:
  • NOT_FULFILLED - none of the order items are fulfilled or order was manually marked as unfulfilled
  • FULFILLED - All of the order items are fulfilled or order was manually marked as fulfilled Orders without shipping info are fulfilled automatically
  • PARTIALLY_FULFILLED - Some, but not all of the order items are fulfilled

Possible values are:
  • INITIALIZED
  • APPROVED
  • CANCELED

Possible values are:
  • UNSPECIFIED
  • NOT_PAID - Order is not paid
  • PAID - Order is paid
  • PARTIALLY_REFUNDED - Order was refunded, refund amount less than order total price
  • FULLY_REFUNDED - Full order total price was refunded
  • PENDING - Payments received but not yet confirmed by the payment provider
  • PARTIALLY_PAID - At least one payment was received and approved, covering less than total price amount

Possible values are:
  • UNSPECIFIED
  • WEB
  • POS
  • EBAY
  • AMAZON
  • OTHER_PLATFORM
  • WIX_APP_STORE
  • WIX_INVOICES
  • BACKOFFICE_MERCHANT
  • WISH
  • CLASS_PASS
  • GLOBAL_E

Possible values are:
  • UNSPECIFIED_WEIGHT_UNIT - Weight unit can't be classified, due to an error
  • KG - Kilograms
  • LB - Pounds

Possible values are:
  • ASC
  • DESC

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_SOURCE_TYPE
  • WIX_APP
  • EXTERNAL
  • ADMIN
  • OTHER

Possible values are:
  • Unknown
  • Replace
  • Before
  • After

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_VALUE_TYPE
  • STRING
  • DATE
  • BOOLEAN
  • NUMBER

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_CUSTOM_FIELD_GROUP
  • BUSINESS_DETAILS
  • CUSTOMER_DETAILS
  • DOCUMENT
  • FOOTER
  • OTHER

InvoiceStatus allowed transitions based on current status: Draft -> Deleted, Paid, Partially Paid, Sent Sent -> Draft, Deleted, Void, Paid, Partially Paid, Processing, (Overdue) Processing -> PartiallyPaid, Paid, Sent Paid -> Void PartiallyPaid -> Void, (PartialAndOverdue) Void -> Deleted Deleted Possible values are:
  • Draft
  • Sent
  • Processing
  • Paid
  • Overdue
  • Void
  • Deleted
  • PartiallyPaid
  • PartialAndOverdue

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • FLAT
  • PERCENTAGE
